essay:
Ever since I wrote my first Python script at 13, I’ve been obsessed with making systems more efficient. While many people see code as logic, I see it as language — a way to communicate ideas with precision. My interest in computer science has led me to explore algorithm design, data processing, and AI.

My goal is to become a software engineer who builds scalable systems for social impact — particularly in public data transparency. I’ve led multiple [INSTITUTION_REDACTED]-driven decision-making, and I’m currently building a model that predicts local air quality patterns.

I’m motivated by competition and collaboration alike. I’ve often competed with my classmate Sara in hackathons, pushing each other to improve. That friendly rivalry has sharpened my focus and made me appreciate the power of teamwork in innovation.
achievements:
1st Place, National Robotics Challenge [PHONE_REDACTED])

Founder, High [INSTITUTION_REDACTED], TechnoWorks Lab (IoT Prototype Development)

Volunteer, STEM Mentorship Program for Girls

Runner-up, National Coding Olympiad

While many people see code as logic, I see it as language — a way to communicate ideas with precision. My interest in computer science has led me to explore algorithm design, data processing, and AI.
